newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ivory Coast names new cocoa/coffee board head.
newsitem.headline: Ivory Coast names new cocoa/coffee board head.

text.p: Ivory Coast has named a former Ivorian economist at the International Monetary Fund as the new head of its Caisse de Stabilisation (Caistab) cocoa and coffee marketing board.

A cabinet statement, published in the government daily Fraternite Matin on Friday, said that President Henri Konan Bedie had signed a decree appointing Yves-Marie Koissy as the board's new managing director.

Koissy, an economist who is also close to Bedie, replaces Rene Amany who has been nominated to the board of the state-owned bank, Banque Internationale pour l'Afrique Occidentale en Cote d'Ivoire (BIAO-CI).

Bedie, who took over on the death of independence president Felix Houphouet-Boigny in 1993 and won election in October, started shuffling ministers and heads of leading state companies after returning in July from an extended visit to Europe.

The statement said that he had also signed decrees on Thursday replacing the head of the state forest development board SODEFOR and of the state company responsible for mechanisation of farming MOTORAGRI.
At SODEFOR, the new managing director is agricultural engineer Emile Jean-Claude Anoh, at MOTORAGRI, another engineer Klodi Kone.
